criterion: Provides advice on how to prevent mild acne on the face
Describes granites as a skin condition, which is incorrect
Asks the user to provide more context about their skin type or other factors that might be contributing to the granites
Responds with overly technical language, making it difficult for the user to understand the advice
Tells the user to seek professional advice from a dermatologist if they are unsure about the cause of the granites
Incorrectly advises the user to use a specific skincare product without considering their skin type or other factors
Asks the user to confirm if they have any underlying conditions that might be contributing to the granites
Provides a clear and concise explanation of the causes and prevention methods for mild acne on the face
Does not mention the importance of maintaining good hygiene and skincare habits in preventing mild acne
Incorrectly states that granites are a type of skin cancer
